content.question: Equimolar amounts of <math alttext="H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></math> and <math alttext="I 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>I</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></math> are pumped into a previously evacuated, rigid <math alttext="1.0 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> container and allowed to attain the equilibrium shown above at a constant temperature. If <math alttext="0.600 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.600</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H I, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is present at equilibrium, how many moles of <math alttext="H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></math> were initially added to the container?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
